C1 Meal Preparation/Kitchen Skills.heading: This is Heading
C1 Meal Preparation/Kitchen Skills.value: Staff engaged the consumer by asking for their input on meal preferences. Following hygiene protocols, staff assisted and guided in meal preparation in alignment with the client’s dietary needs. Staff demonstrated and taught client meal preparation/cooking skills (planning, chopping, cutting, cooking, setting table.)

C1 Meal Preparation/Kitchen Skills.heading: This is Heading
C1 Meal Preparation/Kitchen Skills.value: Staff worked with the client on preparing a meal using a griddle. Staff explained how to measure and mix ingredients and demonstrated how to pour and spread the batter evenly. The client followed along, initially needing guidance on maintaining portion sizes. Staff showed the client how to identify when the food was ready to be flipped and provided support in using the spatula. The client completed the task with supervision and expressed interest in using the griddle again.

C1 Meal Preparation/Kitchen Skills.heading: This is Heading
C1 Meal Preparation/Kitchen Skills.value: Staff guided the client through using a microwave and toaster to prepare a meal. Staff demonstrated how to safely open packaging, transfer items to a microwave-safe dish, and use a cover to prevent spills. Staff reminded consumer that no foil or metal can be used in the microwave. Staff introduced the client to the toaster, explaining how to adjust settings for different textures. The client followed instructions and was reminded to use an oven mitt when removing the food. Staff reinforced the importance of kitchen safety during activity.

Staff assisted the client in using the stove. Staff emphasized safety precautions such as turning pot handles inward, using potholders and maintaining a safe distance from the heat. The client observed staff stirring the food and then attempted to do so independently. Staff provided feedback on how to monitor food and was advised to put hot pots/pans on a safe surface.

Staff encouraged the client to participate in preparing a meal using the stovetop, explaining the process of heating ingredients and monitoring food. The client observed but refused to participate. After several attempts, staff respected the client’s decision and encouraged them to participate in the skill another time.

Staff supported the client in maintaining a clean kitchen space after meal preparation. Staff explained the importance of wiping down counters to prevent bacteria buildup and demonstrated how to use cleaning wipes or a cloth with disinfectant. The client cleaned the counters was reminded to focus on edges and corners. Staff also introduced the client to loading the dishwasher, explaining how to arrange items for optimal cleaning. Staff praised their effort and encouraged them to continue practicing these skills.

Staff introduced the client to using a blender as part of a meal preparation activity. Client helped wash fruits and vegetables and the staff explained how to measure and layer ingredients properly before securing the lid. With staff support, the cliented pressed the start button and watched the process. Staff discussed the importance of ensuring the lid is on tight to prevent spills. The client participated in the task and expressed interest in using the blender for future meals.

Staff introduced the client to using an air fryer to prepare a meal. Staff explained how to preheat the appliance, arrange food evenly, and set the correct cooking time. The client observed but declined to participate, stating they were not interested. Staff encouraged them to try pressing the start button, but the client refused. Staff documented the refusal and planned to offer the opportunity again at another time.

Pointing at pictures - Staff facilitated communication by asking the consumer to point at pictures of food items from peg board and sale papers to express meal preference in alignment with the client's dietary needs. Consumer pointed at multiple items to communicate what they wanted to eat.

C2 Laundry.value: Staff worked with the client on sorting laundry before washing. Staff explained the importance of separating dark and light-colored clothing to prevent color transfer. The client was taught how to check labels and separate items accordingly. Staff then guided the client in loading the washing machine, selecting the appropriate water temperature, measuring and adding detergent, bleach and fabric softener. The client was instructed on how to start the cycle and reminded to avoid overloading the machine. Staff encouraged the client to check back when the cycle was complete to transfer clothes to the dryer.

Staff encouraged the client to participate in laundry chores. The client refused to participate despite encouragement and prompts. Staff reminded them that having clean clothes is an important part of self-care but did not push further. The refusal was documented, and staff planned to revisit the skill at another time.

Staff assisted the client in transferring wet laundry from the washing machine to the dryer. Staff demonstrated how to shake out clothing before placing it in the dryer to prevent wrinkles. The client followed along and was reminded to check that all items were fully transferred. Staff introduced the client to setting the correct drying cycle and explained the importance of cleaning the lint trap. Once the cycle was complete, staff guided the client in folding clothing, explaining how to match socks, fold shirts evenly, and organize items. The client needed encouragement but successfully completed the task.

Staff worked with the client on washing bed linens, explaining that regular cleaning helps maintain hygiene and freshness. Staff demonstrated how to remove pillowcases and fitted sheets and encouraged the client to check for stains before placing items in the washing machine. Staff helped spot clean the mattress. Staff guided them in measuring the correct amount and selecting the proper wash cycle. After the wash cycle was complete, the client transferred the linens to the dryer and with assistance from staff.

Staff introduced the client to ironing and hanging up clothing. Staff explained how to adjust the iron’s temperature setting based on fabric type and demonstrated how to glide the iron smoothly over wrinkles. The client was initially unsure about handling the iron, so staff emphasized safety precautions, such as keeping hands away from the hot surface. The client practiced with a shirt and improved their technique after a few attempts. Staff then demonstrated how to properly hang clothing to maintain its shape. The client hung their clothes and stated they don't prefer ironing and would rather wear them rough dried.

Staff guided the client in folding towels and organizing clean laundry. Staff explained how neatly folded towels take up less space and make it easier to access them when needed. Staff demonstrated a simple folding technique, and the client practiced until they were able to fold towels evenly. The client then helped place the folded towels in the designated storage area. Staff praised their effort and encouraged them to continue practicing to build confidence in maintaining an organized living space.

C3 Housekeeping Skills.value: Staff worked with the client on making their bed as part of their morning routine. Staff explained how a well-made bed contributes to a clean and comfortable living space. Together, they smoothed out the sheets, tucked in the corners, and fluffed the pillows. Staff demonstrated how to tuck corners securely. With guidance, the client completed the task and staff praised their efforts.

Staff assisted the client in sweeping and mopping. Staff demonstrated how to hold the broom at an angle to catch dust and debris and showed the client how to use controlled motions to sweep dirt into a dustpan. The client practiced sweeping and adjusted their technique after feedback. Staff then explained how to wring out excess water before applying the mop to the floor. The client followed along and did well but needed reminders to cover missed spots. Staff praised their effort and encouraged them to take their time for better results.

Staff guided the client through washing and drying dishes, explaining that warm, soapy water helps break down grease and food particles. Staff demonstrated how to scrub thoroughly and rinse off all soap to prevent residue. As the client worked, staff provided gentle corrections and encouraged them to inspect each dish before placing it in the drying rack. The client showed improvement as they gained confidence in their technique.

Staff introduced the client to the steps involved in taking out the trash and replacing the bag. They discussed how regular trash removal prevents odors and keeps the home sanitary. Staff showed the client how to tie the bag securely to prevent leaks and pointed out the designated area for disposal. The client observed and then attempted to tie the bag themselves.

Staff encouraged the client to explore ways to keep their bedroom organized and explained that a tidy space can make finding items easier and create a more relaxing environment. Staff suggested starting with one area, such as putting away clothing, and demonstrated how to fold and stack items neatly. Staff worked alongside them to make task less overwhelming. Staff planned to continue to work on the skill with client.

Staff worked with the client on cleaning the bathroom sink and mirror, explaining that regular cleaning helps prevent buildup and keeps the space sanitary for everyone. Staff introduced them to different cleaning products and demonstrated how to apply cleaner, wipe, and use a dry cloth to prevent streaks on the mirror. Staff encouraged them to check for any missed spots, and the client made small adjustments before finishing the task. Staff praised their thoroughness and encouraged them to keep up the good work.

Staff introduced the client to proper vacuuming techniques, explaining how regular vacuuming removes dirt and dust that accumulate over time. Staff demonstrated how to move it in slow, overlapping strokes, and reach corners effectively. Staff explained the importance of changing the vacuum bag or empty canister and changing the vacuum belt.  Client helped vacuum parts of the room.

C4 Behavioral Interventions Needed.value: Staff observed the client becoming agitated. Staff approached calmly and validated the client’s feelings.  Staff encouraged the client to take a deep breath and step away from the situation to self regulate. Staff engaged the client in a conversation about alternative ways to express frustration and praised them for their efforts. Will continue to work with clients on more coping strategies.

Staff noticed the client’s body language and tone of voice indicating dysregulation. Staff provided verbal redirection to help manage symptoms or behaviors. Staff allowed the client to express their concerns without interruption, validating their feelings with statements such as, “I understand that this is upsetting for you.” Staff suggested multiple coping strategies such as taking a walk, deep breathing, and listening to music to help client improve mood.

The client became visibly upset after a change in routine. Staff validated their feelings, acknowledging that unexpected changes can be difficult. Staff used a calm and reassuring tone to explain that the schedule will return. Staff then encouraged the client to engage in a structured activity, offering choices to regain a sense of control. After some hesitation, the client agreed to do an activity and their agitation gradually decreased.

C5 Total Shopping.value: Staff assisted the client in creating a shopping list, explaining the importance of planning ahead and realizing needs over wants. Client suggested multiple items to be placed on the list. Staff helped client prioritize and categorize items. With guidance, the client completed the list and seemed excited about using it for their shopping trip.

Staff helped the client stay within budget by reviewing available funds and prioritizing essential items. When the client attempted to add extra items, staff encouraged them to compare prices and make choices based on their budget and discussed selecting generic brand items over name brand items. The list was completed with guidance from staff.

Staff assisted client with managing anxiety while in a crowded store.  Client is sometimes uncomfortable around strangers and crowds. Staff guided them through breathing exercises and encouraged focusing on one aisle at a time. The client gradually engaged in shopping and completed their trip with decreased anxiety.

Staff introduced the client to self-checkout, demonstrating how to scan items and complete the transaction. The client was able to complete the task with staff support. Staff provided praise and assured them that they will have more opportunities to practice this activity.

Staff encouraged the client to participate in making a shopping list, but the client refused.  Staff reminded them of its importance and offered to help make a list, but the client remained uninterested. Staff accepted client’s choice and planned to offer participation again next time.

C6 Money Management.value: Staff worked with client to create a budget and explained the importance of tracking expenses. The client struggles with money management. Staff provided guidance and assisted with tracking expenses and planning.  Staff will continue to work with client on money management.

Staff assisted the client in staying within their budget while shopping. The client attempted to add extra items beyond their limit, and staff encouraged them to compare prices and make necessary adjustments. The client reluctantly followed suggestions and successfully completed their purchases within budget.

Staff guided the client in counting cash before making a purchase. The client has difficulty counting money, so staff provided a step-by-step review. With support, the client accurately counted the amount and completed the transaction with support. Staff reminded client to count the change and review the receipt to ensure accuracy.

Staff discussed financial priorities with the client. Client demonstrates difficulty aligning their spending with their available budget. Client selected multiple non-essential or high-cost items and became visibly frustrated when staff redirected them to focus on necessary items within their financial means. Staff provided support in identifying affordable alternatives and encouraged the client to prioritize needs over wants. Budgeting skills and realistic spending habits continue to be an area of focus, with staff offering ongoing guidance and education. By the end of the discussion, the client had a better understanding of prioritizing needs over wants.

Staff worked with client on budgeting fund on their Bridge Card funds throughout the month.  The client often spends all of their funds at the beginning of the month.  Staff encouraged client to budget funds to last throughout the month. The client dismissed the idea, and wanted to spend it all. Staff provided examples of how savings can ensure that they can make purchases later in the month. Staff plans to continue to work on budgeting with the client.

C7 Community/Socialization Skills.value: Staff invited the client to join a group activity in the common area. The client hesitated at first but agreed after staff reassured them that participation was optional. With encouragement from staff, they engaged in conversation and activity with peers and appeared more comfortable as the activity continued.

Staff supported the client in initiating a conversation with a peer. The client struggles with interactions with peers at times, so staff provided prompts to support. Staff provided encouragement and support as needed while client used prompts to engage.

The client often struggles with anxiety during social events.  Staff validated their feelings and reassured them that they will always be with them during outings. Staff practiced how to make eye contact, introduce themselves, and smile when meeting new people. The client role played scenarios with staff.

Staff accompanied the client to a community event and provided reassurance about engaging with others. The client initially stayed close to staff but gradually participated in small conversations. Staff advised and encouraged them to continue practicing social interactions.

Staff invited the client to join activity with peers, but the client declined. Staff acknowledged their feelings and reminded them that they could join later if they changed their mind. The client did not engage, and staff respected their decision.  Client would be encouraged to participate in future activities.

Staff encouraged the client to participate in a planned community outing. Client refused and asked to go shopping.  Staff reminded client that they do not have funds left in their budget for shopping. Client became upset and asked the staff to give them money. Staff stated that they could not give the client money.  Staff reminded client of the benefits of budgeting. Client remained uninterested in attending the community outing. Staff plans to encourage client to participate in future outings.

C8 Attending Medical Appointments.value: Staff assisted the client in preparing for a follow-up healthcare visit by reviewing concerns they wanted to discuss. The staff and client wrote down all concerns and symptoms in preparation for a health care visit. Staff accompanied the client during the appointment.  The client and staff referred to their notes and communicated issues with the healthcare provider. The client engaged with the provider, answered questions about their health, and reviewed follow-up instructions with staff before leaving.

Staff reminded the client about their health care visit, but the client refused to attend.  Staff explained the importance of routine care and assured them staff would accompany them for support throughout the visit. Staff acknowledged their feelings and explained that attending health care appointments are vital to maintaining good overall health. The client declined and staff planned to reschedule the appointment with the provider.

Staff reminded the client about their upcoming dental appointment and assisted them in reviewing what to expect. The client expressed concerns about discomfort, so staff reassured them and discussed the importance of regular checkups. The client agreed to attend and completed the visit without issue.

C9 Medication Instruction Skills.value: Staff prepared water, counted medication, stated the name and reason for each medication. Staff administered the medication as prescribed and documented the dosage and time medication given.
Staff checked the temperature, blood pressure, oxygen level and pulse of client.
Staff applied cream, as directed to area/s of concern.
Staff weighed consumer and recorded results.
Staff noticed a client exhibiting shortness of breath and offered an inhaler.  Client used the inhaler and appeared to experience relief.
Client verbalized that they were experiencing pain and requested a pain pill. Staff gave client PRN.

Staff prepared water, counted medication, stated the name and reason the medication was given. The consumer refused medication despite multiple requests and reminders regarding the importance of medication adherence. An incident report was subsequently completed by the staff.

C10 Health & Safety/Medical Complexity.value: Staff taught hygiene skills including cover your mouth with your elbow or hands when coughing and sneezing. Staff encouraged client to wear their mask, wash their hands, use hand sanitizer and kleenex tissue. Staff emphasized the importance of good hygiene for preventing and spreading viruses.
Staff reminded and educated client on things that are prohibited in the home. Cigarettes, weapons and drugs are contraband and not allowed in the home.
Staff educated client on safety from social media and ways to ensure that they remain safe.  The client was warned of the dangers of agreeing to meet people they met online and sex trafficking.
Staff provided continuous overnight monitoring. Staff provided continuous periodic checks, checking for elopement or respiratory issues.

C11 Symptoms/Stress Management Skills.value: Staff taught client stress management. Client practiced deep breathing and mindfulness techniques as tools to implement when they are dysregulated. Staff also suggested yoga, exercising, going for a walk, calling a friend or loved one and listening to music of choice as options. Additionally, counting to ten, retreating to a quiet area when upset and asking staff for a break or help.

Staff attempted to teach client stress management. Client refused to participate despite multiple attempts and gentle encouragement. Staff will attempt to work on this skill at a later date with client.

P1 Eating/Feeding.value: Staff assisted the client during mealtime. Staff guided table manners, providing verbal cues and demonstration. In addition, staff provided instruction on proper use of silverware, demonstrating how to hold and maneuver the fork and knife. The client was encouraged to practice these skills throughout the meal, with staff offering guidance and support to ensure success.

Staff worked with client on table manners, including using polite eating behaviors such as chewing with the mouth closed, taking small bites, and maintaining appropriate mealtime etiquette. Staff chopped and pureed food as needed. The client was given the opportunity to engage in each of these steps with verbal reminders and positive encouragement.

Staff reminded the client that it was time to eat, but the client refused.  Staff continued to offer meal, prompting the client in a positive, non-pressuring manner, to encourage eating. After several attempts, the client remained non-compliant, and staff respected the client’s decision.

Due to the client’s difficulty with coordination and motor skills, staff provided necessary hand-over-hand assistance, gently guiding the client’s hand to the utensils and ensuring proper use of the silverware. The client demonstrated cooperation with staff assistance, showing no signs of agitation or refusal to eat. Staff monitored the client’s progress throughout the meal, ensuring that the food was consumed in a safe and manageable manner. The client consumed the meal with staff support, and staff continued to encourage the client to slow down, chew food thoroughly, eat in small portions and at a comfortable pace.

P2 Toileting.value: Staff provided assistance in changing the client’s soiled clothes and diaper. Prior to changing the clothes, staff ensured the client was thoroughly cleaned, using wipes to carefully cleanse the client’s skin to prevent discomfort or potential skin irritation. Staff maintained the client’s privacy and dignity throughout the process while ensuring a safe and comfortable environment. After cleaning, staff assisted the client with changing into fresh clothes and a clean diaper and properly disposing of the soiled diaper.

Staff assisted the client with toileting. During this process, the client was instructed on proper hygiene techniques, including how to wipe effectively and the importance of wiping from front to back for cleanliness and to prevent infection. Staff provided verbal guidance and reinforcement to ensure the client understood the process. Additionally, the client was instructed on the proper technique for handwashing, including the steps of using soap, scrubbing for at least 20 seconds, and rinsing and drying hands thoroughly.

The client experienced an accident and appeared embarrassed. Staff responded with reassurance, assisting the client in changing into clean clothing and discussing ways to recognize the urge to use the restroom earlier.

Staff provided 1:1 support and education to the client on proper hygiene practices during their menstrual cycle. The activity included discussion and demonstration of the importance of regular changing of sanitary pads, proper disposal methods, and consistent handwashing before and after changing products.  Additional support will be provided to reinforce steps.

P3 Showering/Bathing/Personal Hygiene.value: Staff  reminded the client that it was time for their scheduled shower and asked them to bathe. The client initially hesitated but agreed after staff provided encouragement. Staff reviewed step by step instructions on how to use a washcloth, rinse and dry off.  The client completed their shower with staff support.

After showering, staff guided the client with using a towel to properly dry off and assisted in selecting clean clothing. Staff helped client with selecting coordinating clothing that fit and appropriate for the weather.

Despite multiple requests and gentle encouragement from staff, the client refused to shower. Staff made several attempts to motivate client to shower, explaining the importance and providing positive reinforcement, but the client remained noncompliant. Staff will explore additional strategies to increase motivation and participation in the sessions.

P4 Dressing.value: Staff reminded the client to change out of their sleepwear and into daytime clothing. The client initially hesitated but agreed after staff encouraged them to pick out a favorite outfit. The client selected an outfit but it was not appropriate. Staff helped and complemented another clothing choice.

Staff supported the client in choosing weather-appropriate clothing. The client initially selected items unsuitable for the temperature, so staff provided guidance on layering. The client adjusted their choices and dressed appropriately with minimal prompting.

Staff practiced fine motor skills tasks with client. Staff demonstrated techniques for client to practice. Staff helped client operate a zipper safely without causing injury. Staff also taught how to lace shoes. Staff will continue to work with client on lacing shoes, buttoning and zipping clothing.

Staff reminded the client that it was time to change clothes for the day, but the client refused. Staff explained the importance of hygiene and self-care but did not push further. Staff planned to revisit the task later.

Staff prompted the client to change into more comfortable clothing for bedtime, but the client refused. Staff explained the benefits of wearing clean sleepwear to bed for comfort. The client remained unwilling, and wore their daytime clothing to bed.

Staff provided detailed instruction to the client on how to coordinate and put on clothing, emphasizing the steps involved in dressing. The client was guided through the process of selecting appropriate clothing, with staff offering verbal prompts and encouragement throughout. Staff demonstrated how to put on socks and shoes, including how to tie the laces, offering step-by-step guidance. Verbal reinforcement and positive encouragement were provided throughout the process, ensuring the client felt supported and confident in their abilities.

Staff provided detailed instruction to the client on how to coordinate and put on clothing, emphasizing the steps involved in dressing. Staff taught the process of selecting appropriate clothing and undergarments. Staff demonstrated how to put on socks and shoes, including how to tie the laces, offering step-by-step guidance. Client refused to participate despite positive encouragement and repeated attempts.

P5 Mobility/Transferring.value: Staff worked on practicing transfers with the client, including transferring to and from the bed, wheelchair, and chair. Staff followed correct body mechanics and provided hands-on assistance as needed. The client actively participated in the transfers and showed progress in the ability to assist with positioning. No incidents or difficulties occurred during activity.

Staff supported the client in safely transferring from their wheelchair to a dining chair. Staff provided verbal prompts and ensured the brakes were locked before assisting. The client followed staff’s guidance and completed the transfer with physical support.

Staff reminded the client that it was time to transfer to bed for rest. The client resisted and stated that they didn’t want to move. Staff explained the benefits of lying down to relax and encouraged client to move to a different position. The staff successfully transferred and positioned the client comfortably.

The client appeared anxious about being transferred and expressed fear of falling. Staff reassured them that safety measures were in place and demonstrated the proper technique. The client remained hesitant but completed the transfer successfully with staff support.

After transferring to bed, the client expressed discomfort and requested assistance adjusting their position. Staff provided guidance on shifting weight and adjusting pillows for support. The client followed prompts and reported feeling more comfortable.

Staff encouraged the client to transfer from their bed to a chair to participate in a scheduled activity. The client refused, stating, “I don’t want to move.” Staff explained the benefits of sitting up for circulation and engagement but did not push further. Staff will reattempt later.

Staff prompted the client to transfer to bed for the night, but the client refused and asked to stay up later. Staff reminded them of the importance of rest and offered assistance. The client continued to decline, and the refusal was documented with plans to reattempt later.

P6 Medication Knowledge/Administration.value: Staff demonstrated/instructed medication management skills- scheduling and measuring dosage with client, reading the label, looking at possible side effects, ensuring it is the correct medication. Client took medication as prescribed.

Staff demonstrated/instructed medication management skills- scheduling and measuring dosage, reading side effects, etc.  Client refused to participate in the activity despite encouragement and multiple attempts from staff.

Staff reminded the client to take their scheduled medication, but the client refused, verbalizing that they don’t need it because they already took it. Staff explained the importance of consistency but did not force compliance. The refusal was documented, an incident report was written and staff will follow up later.

The client repeatedly asked if they were taking the correct dose despite receiving the same prescription for weeks. Staff reassured them by reviewing the medication log and confirming the dosage with them. The client remained cautious but eventually took the medication as prescribed.

P7 Complex Care.value: Staff provided assistance to the client with ambulating.  Client required assistance and steady support. No signs of distress or imbalance were observed during transition. Client was ambulated safely and without incident. Staff encouraged continued practice to increase mobility.
Client was assisted with using the walker and/or wheelchair.

Staff asked client if they wanted to move to another location. Client refused to participate in ambulating activity. Client was reminded of the importance of movement and not remaining in the same spot for an extended amount of time.
